ConfigMapConfig.description:
Configuration for a Kubernetes ConfigMap. Stores non-sensitive
configuration data (config files, environment variables, etc.).

Mount into pods via volumeMounts or inject via envFrom.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this ConfigMap.
enabled.title: Enabled

data.description: Key-value pairs stored as UTF-8 strings. Can hold config files using YAML block scalars: 'config.yaml: |\n  key: value'.
data.title: Data

binaryData.description: Key-value pairs stored as base64-encoded binary data.
binaryData.title: Binarydata

labels.description: Extra labels on the ConfigMap metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the ConfigMap metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

ConfigMapConfig.title: ConfigMapConfig

ContainerPort.description:
A port exposed by a container. The 'name' is used to reference the port
in Service targetPort and probe definitions (e.g. 'http', 'metrics').

name.description: Port name, referenced by services and probes (e.g. 'http').
name.title: Name

containerPort.description: Port number the container listens on.
containerPort.title: Containerport

ContainerPort.title: ContainerPort

CronJobConfig.description:
Configuration for a Kubernetes CronJob. Runs a container on a cron
schedule for batch processing, ETL, data quality checks, cleanup, etc.

Each key in the 'cronjobs' map creates a CronJob named '<release>-<key>'.
Image defaults fall back to 'defaults.image'.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this CronJob.
enabled.title: Enabled

schedule.description: Cron schedule expression, e.g. '0 */2 * * *' (every 2 hours). Use https://crontab.guru to validate.
schedule.title: Schedule

timeZone.description: IANA time zone for the schedule, e.g. 'America/New_York'. Requires Kubernetes >= 1.27.
timeZone.title: Timezone

concurrencyPolicy.description: What to do if a job is still running when the next run is due. 'Forbid' (skip), 'Replace' (kill and restart), or 'Allow' (run concurrently).
concurrencyPolicy.title: Concurrencypolicy

failedJobsHistoryLimit.description: Number of failed job runs to keep for debugging. Default: 1.
failedJobsHistoryLimit.title: Failedjobshistorylimit

successfulJobsHistoryLimit.description: Number of successful job runs to keep. Default: 3.
successfulJobsHistoryLimit.title: Successfuljobshistorylimit

startingDeadlineSeconds.description: Seconds after which a missed schedule is considered failed.
startingDeadlineSeconds.title: Startingdeadlineseconds

suspend.description: Set to true to pause the CronJob without deleting it.
suspend.title: Suspend

backoffLimit.description: Number of retries before marking the job as failed.
backoffLimit.title: Backofflimit

activeDeadlineSeconds.description: Maximum runtime in seconds before the job is killed.
activeDeadlineSeconds.title: Activedeadlineseconds

ttlSecondsAfterFinished.description: Seconds to keep completed job pods before garbage collection.
ttlSecondsAfterFinished.title: Ttlsecondsafterfinished

completions.description: Number of successful completions required. Default: 1.
completions.title: Completions

parallelism.description: Maximum number of pods running in parallel. Default: 1.
parallelism.title: Parallelism

image.description: Container image. Falls back to defaults.image if not set.

env.description: Environment variables for the job container.
env.title: Env

envFrom.description: Bulk environment injection from ConfigMaps or Secrets.
envFrom.title: Envfrom

resources.description: CPU/memory requests and limits. Falls back to defaults.resources.

podSecurityContext.description: Pod-level security context (applies to all containers in the pod).

containerSecurityContext.description: Container-level security context for the job container.

volumeMounts.description: Volume mounts for the job container.
volumeMounts.title: Volumemounts

nodeSelector.description: Node selector labels. Falls back to defaults.nodeSelector.
nodeSelector.title: Nodeselector

tolerations.description: Tolerations for node taints. Falls back to defaults.tolerations.
tolerations.title: Tolerations

affinity.description: Affinity rules. Falls back to defaults.affinity.
affinity.title: Affinity

serviceAccount.description: Service account for the job pods.

labels.description: Extra labels on the CronJob metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the CronJob metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

podLabels.description: Extra labels on the job Pod template.
podLabels.title: Podlabels

podAnnotations.description: Extra annotations on the job Pod template.
podAnnotations.title: Podannotations

CronJobConfig.title: CronJobConfig

Defaults.description:
Default values inherited by all workloads. For deployments, these are
deep-merged (deployment values win). For hooks and cronjobs, individual
fields fall back to these defaults when not set on the resource itself.

Only set values here that genuinely apply to every workload in the release.
Per-workload overrides belong in the individual deployment/cronjob/hook config.

image.description: Default image config. Useful for setting a shared pullPolicy across all workloads.

resources.description: Default CPU/memory requests and limits. Applied to deployments via merge, to hooks and cronjobs via fallback.

securityContext.description: Default container security context. Merged into deployments; not applied to hooks/cronjobs automatically (use podSecurityContext/containerSecurityContext there).

nodeSelector.description: Default node selector labels. Pods will only schedule on nodes matching all labels.
nodeSelector.title: Nodeselector

tolerations.description: Default tolerations. Allows pods to schedule on tainted nodes.
tolerations.title: Tolerations

Defaults.title: Defaults

DeploymentConfig.description:
Configuration for a Kubernetes Deployment. Each key in the 'deployments'
map becomes a separate Deployment resource named '<release>-<key>'.

Example: deployments.data-api creates a Deployment named 'myrelease-golden-chart-data-api'.

Fields not set here inherit from 'defaults' via deep merge.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this deployment. Enabled by default.
enabled.title: Enabled

replicas.description: Number of pod replicas. Ignored when an HPA targets this deployment.
replicas.title: Replicas

strategy.description: Deployment rollout strategy. Example: {type: RollingUpdate, rollingUpdate: {maxSurge: 1, maxUnavailable: 0}}.
strategy.title: Strategy

ports.description: Ports the container exposes. Typically 'http' (app) and 'metrics' (Prometheus).
ports.title: Ports

env.description: Environment variables injected into the main container.
env.title: Env

envFrom.description: Bulk environment injection from ConfigMaps or Secrets. Example: [{configMapRef: {name: app-config}}].
envFrom.title: Envfrom

resources.description: CPU/memory requests and limits. Overrides defaults.resources.

livenessProbe.description: Liveness probe. Restarts the container when it fails. Must set 'enabled: true' to render.

readinessProbe.description: Readiness probe. Removes the pod from Service endpoints when it fails. Must set 'enabled: true' to render.

startupProbe.description: Startup probe. Delays liveness/readiness checks until the app is ready. Use for slow-starting apps (e.g. JVM, large model loading). Must set 'enabled: true' to render.

lifecycle.description: Container lifecycle hooks. Common pattern: {preStop: {exec: {command: ['/bin/sh', '-c', 'sleep 15']}}} for graceful shutdown.
lifecycle.title: Lifecycle

volumeMounts.description: Volume mounts for the main container. Example: [{name: tmp, mountPath: /tmp}].
volumeMounts.title: Volumemounts

initContainers.description: Init containers that run before the main container. Use for migrations, config rendering, or waiting on dependencies.
initContainers.title: Initcontainers

sidecarContainers.description: Additional containers that run alongside the main container. Common uses: log forwarders, proxy sidecars, debug containers.
sidecarContainers.title: Sidecarcontainers

tolerations.description: Tolerations for node taints. Overrides defaults.tolerations.
tolerations.title: Tolerations

topologySpreadConstraints.description: Topology spread constraints for HA. Distributes pods across zones/nodes. Example: [{maxSkew: 1, topologyKey: 'topology.kubernetes.io/zone', whenUnsatisfiable: DoNotSchedule}].
topologySpreadConstraints.title: Topologyspreadconstraints

labels.description: Extra labels added to the Deployment metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations added to the Deployment metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

podLabels.description: Extra labels added to the Pod template metadata.
podLabels.title: Podlabels

podAnnotations.description: Extra annotations added to the Pod template metadata. Common use: Prometheus scrape annotations, Istio sidecar config.
podAnnotations.title: Podannotations

DeploymentConfig.title: DeploymentConfig

EnvVar.description:
A single environment variable injected into a container.
Mirrors the Kubernetes EnvVar spec: set a literal 'value' or use
'valueFrom' to reference a Secret/ConfigMap/field.

value.description: Literal string value. Mutually exclusive with 'valueFrom'.
value.title: Value

valueFrom.description: Reference to a Secret key, ConfigMap key, or field path. Example: {secretKeyRef: {name: db-credentials, key: url}}.
valueFrom.title: Valuefrom

EnvVar.title: EnvVar

GlobalConfig.description:
Global labels and annotations applied to all resources in the chart.
Use for org-wide metadata like cost-center tags, team ownership, or
environment identifiers.

labels.description: Labels added to every resource's metadata. Example: {'team': 'data-platform', 'cost-center': 'engineering'}.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Annotations added to every resource's metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

GlobalConfig.title: GlobalConfig

HPAConfig.description:
Configuration for a HorizontalPodAutoscaler. Automatically scales the
target deployment's replica count based on CPU, memory, or custom metrics.

When an HPA is active, do not set 'replicas' on the target deployment
(the HPA's minReplicas takes over).

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this HPA.
enabled.title: Enabled

targetDeployment.description: Key of the deployment to scale (must match a key in 'deployments').
targetDeployment.title: Targetdeployment

minReplicas.description: Minimum replica count. Set >= 2 for HA.
minReplicas.title: Minreplicas

maxReplicas.description: Maximum replica count. Set based on your capacity budget.
maxReplicas.title: Maxreplicas

metrics.description: Scaling metrics. Example for CPU-based: [{type: Resource, resource: {name: cpu, target: {type: Utilization, averageUtilization: 70}}}].
metrics.title: Metrics

behavior.description: Scale-up and scale-down behavior policies. Use stabilizationWindowSeconds to prevent flapping. Example: {scaleDown: {stabilizationWindowSeconds: 300}}.
behavior.title: Behavior

labels.description: Extra labels on the HPA metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the HPA metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

HPAConfig.title: HPAConfig

HookConfig.description:
Configuration for a Helm hook job. Hooks run at specific points in the
Helm lifecycle (install, upgrade, delete, etc.) and are commonly used for
database migrations, cache warming, or validation checks.

Each key in the 'hooks' map creates a Job named '<release>-hook-<key>'.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this hook.
enabled.title: Enabled

weight.description: Hook execution order (lower runs first). Use negative values (e.g. '-5') to run before other hooks.
weight.title: Weight

deletePolicy.description: When to delete the hook resource. Default: 'before-hook-creation,hook-succeeded'. Add 'hook-failed' to also clean up on failure.
deletePolicy.title: Deletepolicy

backoffLimit.description: Number of retries before marking the job as failed.
backoffLimit.title: Backofflimit

activeDeadlineSeconds.description: Maximum runtime in seconds. The hook is killed if it exceeds this.
activeDeadlineSeconds.title: Activedeadlineseconds

ttlSecondsAfterFinished.description: Seconds to keep completed hook pods before garbage collection.
ttlSecondsAfterFinished.title: Ttlsecondsafterfinished

image.description: Container image. Falls back to defaults.image if not set.

env.description: Environment variables for the hook container.
env.title: Env

envFrom.description: Bulk environment injection from ConfigMaps or Secrets.
envFrom.title: Envfrom

resources.description: CPU/memory requests and limits. Falls back to defaults.resources.

containerSecurityContext.description: Container-level security context for the hook container.

volumeMounts.description: Volume mounts for the hook container.
volumeMounts.title: Volumemounts

nodeSelector.description: Node selector labels. Falls back to defaults.nodeSelector.
nodeSelector.title: Nodeselector

tolerations.description: Tolerations for node taints. Falls back to defaults.tolerations.
tolerations.title: Tolerations

affinity.description: Affinity rules. Falls back to defaults.affinity.
affinity.title: Affinity

restartPolicy.description: Pod restart policy. Default: 'Never' (hooks should not restart).
restartPolicy.title: Restartpolicy

serviceAccount.description: Service account for the hook pod.

labels.description: Extra labels on the hook Job metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the hook Job metadata (in addition to helm.sh/hook).
annotations.title: Annotations

podLabels.description: Extra labels on the hook Pod template.
podLabels.title: Podlabels

podAnnotations.description: Extra annotations on the hook Pod template.
podAnnotations.title: Podannotations

HookConfig.title: HookConfig

ImageConfig.description:
Container image reference. When used inside 'defaults', these values
are inherited by every deployment, cronjob, and hook that does not
specify its own image.

tag.description: Image tag or digest. Prefer pinned versions like 'v2.1.0' over 'latest'.
tag.title: Tag

pullPolicy.description: Kubernetes image pull policy. Use 'Never' for local dev with pre-loaded images, 'IfNotPresent' for production, or 'Always' to force re-pull.
pullPolicy.title: Pullpolicy

ImageConfig.title: ImageConfig

IstioConfig.description:
Istio service mesh configuration. When 'enabled' is true, the chart
renders Istio networking resources (Gateway, VirtualService, DestinationRule).

Requires Istio to be installed in the cluster. All Istio resources are
namespaced and use the networking.istio.io/v1beta1 API.

enabled.description: Enable Istio resource rendering. Set to true when deploying to an Istio-enabled cluster.
enabled.title: Enabled

gateways.description: Map of Istio Gateways. Each key becomes part of the resource name.
gateways.title: Gateways

virtualServices.description: Map of Istio VirtualServices for HTTP/TCP routing rules.
virtualServices.title: Virtualservices

destinationRules.description: Map of Istio DestinationRules for traffic policies (LB, circuit breaking, etc.).
destinationRules.title: Destinationrules

IstioConfig.title: IstioConfig

IstioDestinationRuleConfig.description:
Istio DestinationRule configuration. Defines traffic policies
(load balancing, connection pools, outlier detection) applied after
routing to a specific service.

The 'host' field must reference a service key from the 'services' map.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this DestinationRule.
enabled.title: Enabled

host.description: Service key from the 'services' map to apply this rule to. Resolved to the full service name automatically.
host.title: Host

trafficPolicy.description: Traffic policy with load balancing, connection pools, and outlier detection. Example: {loadBalancer: {simple: LEAST_REQUEST}, outlierDetection: {consecutiveErrors: 5, interval: 30s}}.
trafficPolicy.title: Trafficpolicy

subsets.description: Named subsets for version-based routing (canary, blue-green). Each subset defines labels to match a pod subset.
subsets.title: Subsets

exportTo.description: Namespaces this DestinationRule is visible to.
exportTo.title: Exportto

labels.description: Extra labels on the DestinationRule metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the DestinationRule metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

IstioDestinationRuleConfig.title: IstioDestinationRuleConfig

IstioGatewayConfig.description:
Istio Gateway configuration. Defines a load balancer at the edge of
the mesh that receives incoming HTTP/TCP connections. The Gateway binds
to an Istio ingress gateway workload via the 'selector' field.

Pair with a VirtualService that references this gateway to route traffic
to your services.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this Gateway.
enabled.title: Enabled

selector.description: Label selector for the Istio ingress gateway workload, e.g. {istio: ingressgateway}.
selector.title: Selector

servers.description: Server specifications defining ports, hosts, and TLS settings. Example: [{port: {number: 443, name: https, protocol: HTTPS}, hosts: ['api.example.com'], tls: {mode: SIMPLE, credentialName: my-cert}}].
servers.title: Servers

labels.description: Extra labels on the Gateway metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the Gateway metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

IstioGatewayConfig.title: IstioGatewayConfig

IstioVirtualServiceConfig.description:
Istio VirtualService configuration. Defines traffic routing rules
for requests arriving through a Gateway or from within the mesh.

Route destinations reference service keys from the 'services' map —
the chart automatically resolves them to fully-qualified service names.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this VirtualService.
enabled.title: Enabled

hosts.description: Hostnames this VirtualService applies to, e.g. ['api.example.com'].
hosts.title: Hosts

gateways.description: Gateway keys from 'istio.gateways' to bind to. Use 'mesh' for mesh-internal routing.
gateways.title: Gateways

exportTo.description: Namespaces this VirtualService is visible to. Use ['.'] to restrict to the current namespace.
exportTo.title: Exportto

http.description: HTTP routing rules. Each rule can match on URI, headers, etc. and route to one or more destinations with weights. Supports retries, timeouts, fault injection, and rewrites.
http.title: Http

tcp.description: TCP routing rules for non-HTTP traffic.
tcp.title: Tcp

tls.description: TLS routing rules for passthrough or terminated TLS traffic.
tls.title: Tls

labels.description: Extra labels on the VirtualService metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the VirtualService metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

IstioVirtualServiceConfig.title: IstioVirtualServiceConfig

PVCConfig.description:
Configuration for a PersistentVolumeClaim. Requests durable storage
that survives pod restarts.

Reference the PVC in a deployment's volumes list:
volumes: [{name: data, persistentVolumeClaim: {claimName: '<release>-<key>'}}]

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this PVC.
enabled.title: Enabled

accessModes.description: Access modes: ReadWriteOnce (single node), ReadOnlyMany (multi-node read), ReadWriteMany (multi-node read/write).
accessModes.title: Accessmodes

storageClassName.description: Storage class name. Empty string '' means default class; set to a specific class for SSD, regional, etc.
storageClassName.title: Storageclassname

selector.description: Label selector to bind to a specific PersistentVolume.
selector.title: Selector

volumeName.description: Name of a specific PersistentVolume to bind to (static provisioning).
volumeName.title: Volumename

labels.description: Extra labels on the PVC metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the PVC metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

PVCConfig.title: PVCConfig

ProbeConfig.description:
Health check probe configuration. The chart only renders the probe
when 'enabled' is true, so probes defined in defaults are opt-in.
At least one of httpGet, exec, tcpSocket, or grpc must be set.

enabled.description: Set to true to enable this probe. When false or omitted, the probe is not rendered.
enabled.title: Enabled

initialDelaySeconds.description: Seconds to wait after container start before probing.
initialDelaySeconds.title: Initialdelayseconds

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe.
periodSeconds.title: Periodseconds

timeoutSeconds.description: Seconds after which the probe times out.
timeoutSeconds.title: Timeoutseconds

successThreshold.description: Consecutive successes required to mark the probe as passing.
successThreshold.title: Successthreshold

failureThreshold.description: Consecutive failures required to mark the probe as failing. For startupProbe, this controls the total startup budget: failureThreshold * periodSeconds.
failureThreshold.title: Failurethreshold

ProbeConfig.title: ProbeConfig

ResourceRequirements.description:
CPU and memory resource requests/limits for a container.
Always set requests to guarantee scheduling; set limits to prevent
noisy-neighbor issues on shared nodes.

requests.description: Minimum resources guaranteed to the container, e.g. {cpu: '250m', memory: '256Mi'}.
requests.title: Requests

limits.description: Maximum resources the container can use, e.g. {cpu: '1000m', memory: '1Gi'}.
limits.title: Limits

ResourceRequirements.title: ResourceRequirements

SecretConfig.description:
Configuration for a Kubernetes Secret. Stores sensitive data like
API keys, database credentials, and TLS certificates.

Prefer external secret managers (e.g. AWS Secrets Manager, Vault) for
production. This is useful for dev/test or bootstrap secrets.

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this Secret.
enabled.title: Enabled

stringData.description: Plain-text key-value pairs (automatically base64-encoded by Kubernetes).
stringData.title: Stringdata

labels.description: Extra labels on the Secret metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the Secret metadata.
annotations.title: Annotations

SecretConfig.title: SecretConfig

SecurityContext.description:
Container or pod-level security settings. The chart defaults enforce
non-root, read-only root filesystem, and dropped capabilities.
Override per-deployment only when the workload genuinely requires it.

runAsNonRoot.description: Require the container to run as a non-root user. Should almost always be true.
runAsNonRoot.title: Runasnonroot

runAsUser.description: UID to run the container process as. Common convention is 1000 or 1001.
runAsUser.title: Runasuser

runAsGroup.description: GID to run the container process as.
runAsGroup.title: Runasgroup

fsGroup.description: GID applied to all files in mounted volumes. Useful for shared storage.
fsGroup.title: Fsgroup

readOnlyRootFilesystem.description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read-only. Use emptyDir volumes for /tmp or cache directories if the app needs to write.
readOnlyRootFilesystem.title: Readonlyrootfilesystem

allowPrivilegeEscalation.description: Whether the process can gain more privileges than its parent. Should be false.
allowPrivilegeEscalation.title: Allowprivilegeescalation

capabilities.description: Linux capabilities to add or drop. Default drops ALL: {drop: ['ALL']}.
capabilities.title: Capabilities

seccompProfile.description: Seccomp profile to apply, e.g. {type: RuntimeDefault}.
seccompProfile.title: Seccompprofile

SecurityContext.title: SecurityContext

ServiceAccountConfig.description:
Configuration for a Kubernetes ServiceAccount. Created once per release
and shared by all deployments. Use annotations to bind to cloud IAM roles
(e.g. AWS IRSA, GCP Workload Identity).

create.description: Create a ServiceAccount. Set to false to use the 'default' account.
create.title: Create

name.description: Override the ServiceAccount name. Defaults to the release fullname.
name.title: Name

annotations.description: Annotations on the ServiceAccount. Common use: {'eks.amazonaws.com/role-arn': 'arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/my-role'} for AWS IRSA.
annotations.title: Annotations

automountServiceAccountToken.description: Whether to auto-mount the ServiceAccount token into pods. Set to false if the workload doesn't need Kubernetes API access.
automountServiceAccountToken.title: Automountserviceaccounttoken

ServiceAccountConfig.title: ServiceAccountConfig

ServiceAccountRef.description:
Service account to use for a job or cronjob pod. When 'create' is true,
a dedicated service account is created with the same name as the job resource.

create.description: Create a dedicated service account for this job.
create.title: Create

name.description: Use an existing service account by name instead of creating one.
name.title: Name

ServiceAccountRef.title: ServiceAccountRef

ServiceConfig.description:
Configuration for a Kubernetes Service. Each key in the 'services' map
creates a Service named '<release>-<key>'.

Use 'targetDeployment' to set up label selectors that route traffic to
the matching deployment's pods (matched via app.kubernetes.io/component).

enabled.description: Set to false to skip rendering this service.
enabled.title: Enabled

type.description: Service type. ClusterIP for internal, LoadBalancer for external access, NodePort for development.
type.title: Type

targetDeployment.description: Key of the deployment to target (must match a key in 'deployments'). Sets the app.kubernetes.io/component selector label.
targetDeployment.title: Targetdeployment

clusterIP.description: Explicit cluster IP. Set to 'None' for headless services.
clusterIP.title: Clusterip

loadBalancerIP.description: Static IP for LoadBalancer services (cloud-provider dependent).
loadBalancerIP.title: Loadbalancerip

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description: CIDR ranges allowed to access a LoadBalancer service.
loadBalancerSourceRanges.title: Loadbalancersourceranges

externalTrafficPolicy.description: 'Local' preserves client source IP but may cause imbalanced traffic. 'Cluster' (default) distributes evenly.
externalTrafficPolicy.title: Externaltrafficpolicy

sessionAffinity.description: 'ClientIP' to enable sticky sessions, 'None' (default) for round-robin.
sessionAffinity.title: Sessionaffinity

extraSelectorLabels.description: Additional labels added to the Service's pod selector beyond the defaults.
extraSelectorLabels.title: Extraselectorlabels

nodePorts.description: Map of port name to static NodePort number. Only used when type is NodePort. Example: {http: 30080}.
nodePorts.title: Nodeports

labels.description: Extra labels on the Service metadata.
labels.title: Labels

annotations.description: Extra annotations on the Service metadata. Common use: cloud load balancer configuration.
annotations.title: Annotations

ServiceConfig.title: ServiceConfig

ServicePort.description:
A port exposed by a Kubernetes Service. Maps an external port to a
container port or named port on the target pods.

name.description: Port name. Must match when using named targetPort references.
name.title: Name

targetPort.description: Container port or named port to route traffic to (e.g. 8080 or 'http').
targetPort.title: Targetport

ServicePort.title: ServicePort

nameOverride.description: Override the chart name used in resource names. Default is the chart name ('golden-chart').
nameOverride.title: Nameoverride

fullnameOverride.description: Fully override the resource name prefix. When set, all resources are named '<fullnameOverride>-<key>'.
fullnameOverride.title: Fullnameoverride

namespaceOverride.description: Override the target namespace. By default, resources use the namespace from 'helm install -n <ns>'.
namespaceOverride.title: Namespaceoverride

imagePullSecrets.description: Image pull secrets for private registries, applied to all pods. Example: [{name: 'my-registry-secret'}].
imagePullSecrets.title: Imagepullsecrets

global.description: Global labels and annotations applied to all resources.

defaults.description: Default values inherited by all workloads. Deployments deep-merge with these; hooks and cronjobs use them as fallbacks.

deployments.description: Map of Kubernetes Deployments. Each key creates a Deployment named '<release>-<key>'.
deployments.title: Deployments

services.description: Map of Kubernetes Services. Use 'targetDeployment' to route traffic to a specific deployment.
services.title: Services

configMaps.description: Map of ConfigMaps for non-sensitive configuration data.
configMaps.title: Configmaps

secrets.description: Map of Secrets for sensitive data. Consider external secret managers for production.
secrets.title: Secrets

persistentVolumeClaims.description: Map of PersistentVolumeClaims for durable storage.
persistentVolumeClaims.title: Persistentvolumeclaims

horizontalPodAutoscalers.description: Map of HPAs for auto-scaling deployments based on metrics.
horizontalPodAutoscalers.title: Horizontalpodautoscalers

cronjobs.description: Map of CronJobs for scheduled batch processing (e.g. dbt runs, data quality checks, cleanup tasks).
cronjobs.title: Cronjobs

hooks.description: Map of Helm hook jobs that run during install/upgrade lifecycle (e.g. database migrations, cache warming).
hooks.title: Hooks

istio.description: Istio service mesh configuration (Gateway, VirtualService, DestinationRule).

serviceAccount.description: ServiceAccount configuration shared by all deployments in the release.

extraResources.description: Arbitrary Kubernetes manifests rendered as-is. Escape hatch for resources the chart doesn't natively support.
extraResources.title: Extraresources
